name: @blake365/macrostrat-mcp
description: Explore global geologic data to answer questions about bedrock, formations, ages, and stratigraphy. Retrieve units, columns, minerals, timescales, and definitions for any location to build accurate geological context. Generate geology map tiles for quick visualization of areas of interest.

tools.name: find-columns
tools.title: Find Columns
tools.description: Find geological stratigraphic columns, rock layers, and geological history for any location worldwide. Use for geology, bedrock, formations, age dating, and stratigraphic analysis.

lat.description: A valid latitude in decimal degrees

lng.description: A valid longitude in decimal degrees

responseType.description: The length of response long or short

tools.name: find-units
tools.title: Find Units
tools.description: Find geological rock units, formations, bedrock geology, and mineral information for any location worldwide. Use for geology questions, rock types, age dating, lithology, and geological analysis.

lat.description: A valid latitude in decimal degrees

lng.description: A valid longitude in decimal degrees

responseType.description: The length of response long or short. Long provides lots of good details

tools.name: defs
tools.title: Definitions
tools.description: Routes giving access to standard fields and dictionaries used in Macrostrat

parameters.description: parameters to pass to the endpoint

tools.name: defs-autocomplete
tools.title: Definitions Autocomplete
tools.description: Quickly retrieve all definitions matching a query. Limited to 100 results

tools.name: mineral-info
tools.title: Mineral Information
tools.description: Get information about a mineral, use one property

element.description: An element that the mineral is made of

tools.name: timescale
tools.title: Timescale
tools.description: Get information about a time period

age.description: Age in millions of years before present

tools.name: lat-lng-to-tile
tools.title: Latitude/Longitude to Tile
tools.description: Convert latitude/longitude coordinates to map tile coordinates (x, y) for a given zoom level. Uses the same web mercator projection as MapKit.

tools.name: map-tiles
tools.title: Map Tiles
tools.description: Get map tile URLs from the Macrostrat tiles server. Use lat-lng-to-tile tool first to get proper x,y coordinates. Defaults to 'carto' scale which automatically adapts detail level to zoom.

x.description: Tile X coordinate - use lat-lng-to-tile tool to calculate this from lat/lng

y.description: Tile Y coordinate - use lat-lng-to-tile tool to calculate this from lat/lng

z.description: Zoom level (0-18). Higher zoom = more detailed view of smaller area. Typical values: z=3 (continent), z=6 (country), z=10 (city), z=15 (neighborhood)

scale.description: Map scale layer - 'carto' automatically selects appropriate detail level based on zoom. Other scales (tiny, small, medium, large) may have limited coverage.

format.description: Tile format: 'png' for images, 'mvt' for vector tiles

fetch_image.description: If true, actually fetch the tile image data so Claude can analyze the geological features visually
